name: Cape Coast Castle
address: Cape Coast Castle, Cape Coast, Ghana

name: Elmina Castle
description: Built by the Portuguese in 1482, it is the oldest European building in Sub-Saharan Africa.

name: Kakum National Park
address: Kakum National Park, Central Region, Ghana
description: Known for its rainforest canopy walkway and diverse wildlife including forest elephants and monkeys.

name: Cape Coast University Botanical Gardens
address: University of Cape Coast, Cape Coast, Ghana
description: A serene environment for learning and relaxing, showcasing a variety of plant species.

name: Fort William Lighthouse
description: A red-and-white striped colonial lighthouse offering views of the coastline.

name: Cape Coast Market
description: A bustling market with local goods, textiles, food, and cultural artifacts.

name: Brenu Beach
description: A quiet beach ideal for relaxation and long walks, away from the city center.

name: Posuban Shrine
description: Colorful traditional shrines of the Asafo companies featuring symbolic artwork and figures.
